intro: Sonchus pulchellus, commonly known as the pretty sow-thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and produces yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive, somewhat bitter taste. Sonchus pulchellus is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
